thread.title: Dietary Supplements Put 23,000 Americans in ER Each Year
thread.title_full: Dietary Supplements Put 23,000 Americans in ER Each Year - US News

author: USNews
title: Dietary Supplements Put 23,000 Americans in ER Each Year
text:
Health Buzz: Dietary Supplements Put 23,000 Americans in ER Each Year Young adults using weight-loss or energy products complained of heart symptoms.
Study found young adults most likely to be affected.
By Lisa Esposito Oct. 15, 2015 | 11:50 a.m. EDT + More Herbal and other nutritional products, energy boosters and vitamin and mineral supplements are to blame for 23,005 emergency department visits each year, according to a new 10-year study .
Young adults between 20 and 34 were most likely to come in with side effects such as heart palpitations , chest pains or rapid heart rate, according to findings released Thursday in the New England Journal of Medicine. Weight-loss and energy products were the most common supplements named.
Unsupervised kids were the next most affected, followed by adults ages 65 and older. In seniors, choking and swallowing problems were most common, most often related to vitamin and mineral supplements .
Study estimates came from 2004-to-2013 data from 63 emergency departments across the U.S. Those visits resulted in an estimated 2,154 hospitalizations each year.
"This is very disheartening," Dr. Pieter Cohen, an assistant professor at Harvard Medical School who was not involved in the new research, told The New York Times . "What we're seeing from this study is that the system has failed. It's failing to protect consumers from very serious harms."â€‹
Along with this new research on ER visits, dietary supplements have come under scrutiny for number of reasons. "Brain-boosting" supplements marketed to seniors to stave off dementia became the subject of a Senate investigation in June. Experts have questioned the potency of vitamin supplements and the accuracy and reliability of product labeling.

TAGS: supplements weight loss vitamins hospitals
